meanings.sent1: I caught a big ged while fishing in the lake.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen were excited to reel in a ged from the deep waters.
meanings.sent3: The ged swam swiftly, trying to avoid being caught by the anglers.
meanings.sent4: The shiny scales of the ged glistened under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The children gathered around to see the strange-looking ged up close.

meanings.definition: A pointed tool for making holes in wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a sharp ged to create precise holes in the wooden plank.
meanings.sent2: She carefully selected the right sized ged for her woodworking project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the ged for a nut and tried to bury it in the ground.
meanings.sent4: With each strike of the ged, the woodworker could hear the satisfying sound of progress.
meanings.sent5: The old ged had been passed down through generations of craftsmen.

meanings.definition: To fish with a hook and line.
meanings.sent1: We decided to ged for our dinner by the river.
meanings.sent2: He taught his son how to ged in the calm waters of the pond.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to ged a toy mouse dangling from a string.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to ged a big catch to impress her friends.
meanings.sent5: The friends planned a weekend trip to ged together and enjoy nature.
